subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Thursday, 31 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Man Utd seal deal for Hargreaves
Man Utd confirm England midfielder Owen Hargreaves will join them from Bayern Munich on 1 July.



 
Worthington set to be NI manager
Nigel Worthington is to be unveiled as the new Northern Ireland manager on Friday, BBC Sport understands.



 
Terry determined to save McClaren
England skipper John Terry admits coach Steve McClaren could lose his job if they lose in Estonia.








GOLF




Wales Open leaderboard
The first round of the Wales Open is under way at Celtic Manor.



 
Wie set to play more men's events
Michelle Wie says her coach David Leadbetter was misquoted when he said she would not play in any more men's events.



 
Dredge eyes home Wales Open win
Bradley Dredge is on a quest to become the first home winner of the Celtic Manor Wales Open.








MOTORSPORT




McLaren cleared over Hamilton row
McLaren are cleared of any wrongdoing after an investigation into whether they illegally used team orders in the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Stewart backs McLaren on Hamilton
F1 great Sir Jackie Stewart says McLaren did the right thing in asking Fernando Alonso and Lewis Hamilton not to race in Monaco.



 
McLaren race victory to be probed
Formula One's governing body will investigate McLaren for a possible breach of the rules in Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix.








FORMULA ONE

McLaren are cleared of any wrongdoing after an investigation into whether they illegally used team orders in the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Stewart backs McLaren on Hamilton
F1 great Sir Jackie Stewart says McLaren did the right thing in asking Fernando Alonso and Lewis Hamilton not to race in Monaco.



 
McLaren race victory to be probed
Formula One's governing body will investigate McLaren for a possible breach of the rules in Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




Radcliffe contract still unsigned
Paula Radcliffe has still not signed a central contract with UK Athletics, even though the deadline expired almost a year ago.



 
GB set finals target for Worlds
Athletics chiefs target a minimum of 14 British athletes reaching their finals at the World Championships in Japan.



 
Lewis-Francis pleased with upturn
Mark Lewis-Francis gives a hint of a possible upturn in form by finishing third to Asafa Powell in a 100m in Belgrade.








CYCLING




Petacchi claims fourth Giro stage
Alessandro Petacchi takes the 18th stage of the Giro d'Italia to extend his commanding lead in the sprint standings.



 
Simoni wins tough mountain stage
Gilberto Simoni wins the 17th stage of the Giro d'Italia but fellow Italian Danilo Di Luca retains the overall lead.



 
Drug revelations spark IOC probe
Olympic authorities are to look into possible doping offences at past Games following recent admissions by former riders of the Telekom team.
